column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#Text=[0021] Exemplary patents that disclose NGJ methods include U.S.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=Nos. 6,695,992; 6,520,425; and 6,382,526, all of which are incorporated by reference in their entireties.
#Text=A suitable electrospinning process is disclosed in, for example, U.S.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=No. 6,753,454, which is hereby incorporated by reference in its entirety.
#Text=EXAMPLE 1
#Text=[0022] An example of the present invention comprises the synthesis of compact solid silica fibers as described below.

#Text=A sol-gel solution is made by adding tetraethyl orthosilicate (TEOS) (44.7 mL, 0.2 M), ammonium hydroxide (18 mL, 0.2 M), and water (45 mL, 3.2 M) to a reaction vessel, which is topped off to 1 liter using ethanol (about 890 mL).
#Text=Nylon 6 (20 wt % solution in formic acid) nanofibers are electrospun at 15 cm distance and 20 kV directly into the sol-gel solution.
#Text=The sol-gel solution with the Nylon-6 fibers suspended therein is left at room temperature for about 20 hours without agitation.
#Text=The particle size resulting from this process is about 100 nm.
#Text=The nylon 6 web does not dissolve.
#Text=The web is washed twice by suspending in ethanol and leaving titania nanofibers with 150 nm diameters as seen in FIG. 2C.
#Text=Shrinkage in the diameter of the nanofibers is observed when the nanofibers are heated, due to the thermal degradation of the polymer.
#Text=EXAMPLE 3
#Text=[0023] In another example of the present invention hollow nanofibrous structures are formed according to the following process.
#Text=In order to sol-gel coat 0.2 grams of nylon-6 nanofibers, 110 ml of filtered distilled water is added to 15.2 ml of 5 M nitric acid at room temperature.
#Text=After mixing, 7.6 ml of 2-propanol is then slowly added.
#Text=Next, 1.6 ml of titanium isopropoxide is gradually added with a pipette and the solution is ultrasonically agitated for 30 minutes.
#Text=After half an hour the solution becomes transparent indicating the formation of a sol having nano-scale particles.
#Text=The electrospun polymer nanofibers are then placed in the sol and the mixture is heated to 65.degree.
#Text=C. for two hours.
#Text=This induces the growth of titania nanoparticles on the surface of the nanofibers.
#Text=The solution becomes cloudy after about two hours, indicating precipitation.
#Text=The precipitate is separated from the solution by washing several times with methanol, which also removed residual alkoxides.
